decks.notes: The deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells, aimed at disrupting the opponent's game plan while pushing through damage quickly. The deck utilizes a mix of powerful creatures like Solitude and Seasoned Pyromancer, as well as versatile spells like Ephemerate and Prismatic Ending to control the board and push towards victory. The deck's strategy is to apply pressure early on and disrupt the opponent's resources, forcing them to react to the threats presented while still maintaining a solid offensive presence.

The deck revolves around putting artifacts into play quickly and efficiently, using cards like Mox Opal and Urza's Saga to generate mana advantage. It aims to swarm the board with artifact creatures like Pinnacle Emissary and Kappa Cannoneer, while also disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Engineered Explosives and Metallic Rebuke. Emry, Lurker of the Loch provides recursion for key artifacts, while cards like Claws of Gix and Tormod's Crypt offer additional utility. The deck is aggressive and looks to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of creature threats and disruptive elements.

This deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures while disrupting the opponent's game plan with taxing effects. By combining efficient creatures like Ragavan and Quantum Riddler with disruption spells like Prismatic Ending and Consign to Memory, the deck aims to pressure the opponent while controlling the pace of the game. The inclusion of cards like Solitude and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd provide additional value and protection for your creatures. The deck also utilizes powerful finishers like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker to secure the win in the late game.

This UW Control deck focuses on countering and controlling the opponent's spells while drawing cards and preventing them from drawing with cards like Narset, Parter of Veils and Orim's Chant. It also aims to lock the opponent out of the game with powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and board wipes like Supreme Verdict. The deck includes removal spells like Prismatic Ending and Solitude to deal with threats efficiently. Additionally, it has some win conditions in the form of March of Otherworldly Light and LÃ³rien Revealed to close out the game.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on fast, aggressive creatures and burn spells to overwhelm the opponent quickly. The deck relies on efficient creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Guide of Souls, combined with powerful burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and Thraben Charm. Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury provide additional support and finishers. Blood Moon disrupts opponent's mana base, while Seasoned Pyromancer helps with card advantage. The deck aims to close out the game quickly with a strong board presence and direct damage spells.

The deck focuses on quickly getting Atraxa, Grand Unifier onto the battlefield by using Goryo's Vengeance to reanimate her from the graveyard. This is supported by a variety of disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Force of Negation to protect the combo and control the opponent's board. The deck also includes a suite of creatures with powerful instant abilities like Solitude and Subtlety, which can be blinked with Ephemerate for additional value. Overall, the deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's game plan to secure a win.

The deck aims to assemble Jeskai Ascendancy along with various artifacts and cheap spells to generate mana and draw cards. Emry, Lurker of the Loch can recur artifacts from the graveyard, while Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provides card advantage. Portable Hole and Repeal offer removal options, while Metallic Rebuke provides counterplay. The deck utilizes Urza's Saga to tutor for necessary pieces and create artifact tokens. Overall, the deck focuses on quickly assembling the Jeskai Ascendancy combo to create a loop of spells and mana production for a powerful finish.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana with cards like Birthing Ritual and Coiling Oracle to play powerful spells like Subtlety and Abhorrent Oculus, with the aim of overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and disruptive spells. The deck focuses on generating value through card advantage with cards like Shardless Agent and Fblthp, the Lost while also having answers to opponent's threats with cards like Force of Negation and Endurance. Overall, the deck aims to apply early pressure and maintain control of the game with a mix of aggression and disruption.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by utilizing powerful Eldrazi creatures and the Tron lands (Urza's Mine, Urza's Tower, Urza's Power Plant) to generate massive amounts of mana. The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategies with cards like Thought-Knot Seer and Karn, the Great Creator while also ramping into huge threats like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger and Emrakul, the Promised End. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with its high power level and efficient mana production.

This deck focuses on utilizing the Neoform combo to quickly assemble the Allosaurus Rider and either a large creature like Ghalta or a combo piece like Griselbrand. Consign to Memory and Pact of Negation provide protection while Planar Genesis and Bridgeworks Battle help ramp up mana quickly. The deck also includes various tools like Disciple of Freyalise and Veil of Summer to support the combo strategy. Overall, the key concept is to efficiently assemble the combo pieces and disrupt opponent's plans to secure a win.

This deck focuses on utilizing the Amulet of Vigor to power out powerful combo pieces such as Primeval Titan and Scapeshift. By utilizing lands with powerful ETB effects and utilizing cards like Arboreal Grazer to ramp into bigger spells quicker, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with powerful land-based combos. The inclusion of cards like Boseiju, Who Endures and Lotus Field provide additional utility and protection for key combo pieces. The main goal is to assemble the necessary pieces to quickly ramp into powerful threats and overwhelm opponents with a strong board presence.

This deck focuses on generating mana quickly through rituals and Medallions to cast powerful spells like Ral, Monsoon Mage and Past in Flames. It also utilizes card draw and recursion effects to set up a big finish with Grapeshot or Wish. The key strategy is to chain together spells and generate enough mana to create a storm of spells in a single turn, overwhelming the opponent with a powerful combo. The deck includes flexible cards like Valakut Awakening and Raucous Theater to help dig for key pieces and maintain consistency in executing the combo.

This deck focuses on quickly getting artifacts onto the battlefield, especially Emry, Lurker of the Loch, in order to generate value and tempo. The combination of cheap artifacts, card draw like Mishra's Bauble, and interaction like Metallic Rebuke allows the deck to disrupt opponents while maintaining its aggressive strategy. Urza's Saga can also provide additional threats and card advantage. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a fast and synergistic game plan that leverages the power of artifacts and efficient spells.

The deck focuses on utilizing artifacts to quickly ramp up board presence and overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. By deploying a mix of cheap artifacts and efficient creatures, the deck aims to control the board while establishing a strong offensive presence. Using cards like Urza's Saga and Mox Opal to generate mana advantage, the deck can rapidly build towards powerful plays and quickly close out games. With a combination of card advantage, mana efficiency, and aggressive threats, the deck aims to maintain tempo and pressure throughout the match.

This deck focuses on quickly dealing damage to the opponent by utilizing cheap and efficient spells like Lightning Bolt, Lava Dart, and Cori-Steel Cutter. The deck also includes cards like Mishra's Bauble and Expressive Iteration to help dig for more threats. Dragon's Rage Channeler and Monastery Swiftspear are key creatures that benefit from playing multiple spells in one turn. The deck aims to apply early pressure and close out the game before the opponent can stabilize, with cards like Violent Urge and Unholy Heat to help push through for that final damage.

The main idea of this Dredge combo deck is to use cards like Faithless Looting and Life from the Loam to fill the graveyard with cards quickly. This enables the player to bring back powerful creatures like Arclight Phoenix and Creeping Chill from the graveyard to the battlefield. By utilizing cards like Burning Inquiry and Thundering Falls to draw and discard cards, the player can establish a strong board presence and overwhelm the opponent. This deck focuses on quickly assembling powerful combinations of cards to win the game in a fast and explosive manner.
